Message.Title: OMG, the flagship handset of QCOM's 3rd major customer, HTC One, is also in trouble.....
Message.Msg: Google translation: New HTC One supply situation firepower from the end of May onwards, however, the supply chain broke, Q3 HTC HTC One component of the new orders had shrunk to less than 3 million, compared to the second quarter of the new HTC One even suffered out of the pain, but also recklessly out of about 320 to 3.5 million in shipments, the first three quarters seems a little weak. High-end smartphones is already saturated to no longer marketable? Remains to be seen. Original : chinatimesDOTcom/focus/11050106/122013061000082.html 06/10/2013 " 新HTC One供應狀況從5月底起火力全開，然而供應鏈傳出，宏達電第3季對新HTC One零組件下單量縮減至不到300萬支，比起第2季新HTC One就算飽受缺貨之苦，也硬拼出約320~350萬支的出貨量來說，第3季似乎有點弱。高階智慧型手機是否已經飽和至賣不動？仍有待觀察。 Here is my translation of the Google translation, in part: HTC has reduced Q3 orders to 3 million units, which is an unexpected further reduction from the 3.2-3.5 million shipping figure in a quarter that suffered severe supply constraints.

Topic.Title: OMG, the flagship handset of QCOM's 3rd major customer, HTC One, is also in trouble.....

Message.Msg: Qualcomm gets hit three ways in near and intermediate terms: Apple, Samsung, HTC. In a way it is a blessing in disguise that NVDA's Tegra 4 is not currently exposed to the high-end phone market, instead T4 is positioned for the tablet/laptop segments where much less hesitation of consumer is seen.

Topic.Title: How many discrete nvidia chips can beat the Haswell 5200, and what are their prices.

Message.Msg: #$%$ you talkin bout rufus? NVDA is well positioned in many segments.

Topic.Title: OMG, the flagship handset of QCOM's 3rd major customer, HTC One, is also in trouble.....

Message.Msg: I'd be surprised if the HTC One really is going to be reduced in the near term, at least through this year. I had to buy a new phone recently and ended up getting the HTC One because it 'currently' is the best high-end smartphone out there now IMO. I wanted to wait until some of the T4i phones came out but my old phone really just couldn't last (though it really did take a beating from me and used Tegra 2 believe it or not). I hope to be getting one of the new laptops or combo units (tablet and keyboard) with Tegra 4(5?) at some point. If you were looking in the market right now for a smartphone, the word on the street favors something like the HTC One (for now) which hurts both the market for iPhones and Samsung 3 and 4. So Qualcomm ultimately loses overall on what they project in their outlook, but can claim a victory in one very well designed phone. BTW, I think HTC One would be a hit whether it has Tegra 4/4i or Snapdragon chipsets. It's the overall design of the phone that sells it, much like the way iPhone has in the past with their first entries and design. I think the real news for Nvidia is in the gaming ecosystem and similar ecosystems in cars and anywhere else they can envision the use of their mobile and high-end graphics know how. Catching larger volume with growing margin is where they well be hitting Qualcomm hard, ie sub-$200 phones, cloud systems in design and gaming, cars and other transit systems and so on. It's going to be fun for Nvidia investors . .

Topic.Title: OMG, the flagship handset of QCOM's 3rd major customer, HTC One, is also in trouble.....

Message.Msg: The fact is that HTC has trimmed Q3 orders for One. This apparently caught the locals/suppliers in surprise too, as they had expected a pent-up situation in Q2 would have generated an robust increase in orders. With all due respect, I think it is safe to assume that HTC knows the demand situation better than you or me, or anyone in the user's camp. Don't forget, also, the smart phone market is a bit like real estate, showing unique sales profile depending on localities. Overall, on a global basis, HTC isn't so optimistic about their ONE, thus trimming the orders for Q3.

Topic.Title: OMG, the flagship handset of QCOM's 3rd major customer, HTC One, is also in trouble.....

Message.Msg: I think this is only true if the market for high-end smartphones is fading across the board (and Nvidia would realize that too). I don't think the news you are picking up really says much and it will be more evident at the end of the year what is really happening overall. My main point was the HTC One may actually hurt Qualcomm's bottomline more then it helps because of what I think it could be doing to the latest iPhone sales and the latest Samsung (3 & 4) sales. Especially if the overall high-end is diminishing at least for the smartphones, not necessarily the tablets.

NVDA is Tegra 4i is exactly positioned for this market. Only wish that it would be released sooner than Q1 of 2014.

Message.Title: "The Best of Computex 2013: inWin, NZXT, Corsair and AMD"
Message.Msg: "The Best of Computex 2013: inWin, NZXT, Corsair and AMD" "AMD AMD had a sizeable presence at the show divided between its experience zone, where its chips in devices were demoed, and its keynote. AMD’s keynote wasn’t anything groundbreaking, though it did show off a next-generation Kaveri APU. What makes AMD’s presence at Computex stand out is the fact that Intel is now following in its footsteps. Intel is arguably pushing an APU by any other name with Haswell, something remarkable since the company was playing catch up to Intel year-over-year for most of the last half-decade." Source: hardwarecanucks

Message.Title: "Club 3D: Bye Bye nVidia - Exclusive partnership with AMD"
Message.Msg: "Club 3D: Bye Bye nVidia - Exclusive partnership with AMD" "The Dutch manufacturer of hardware Club 3D (first established as a power color) announced in a recent press release that they will soon only working with AMD and say goodbye to products based on nVidia graphics units. Club 3D, which is known not only for graphics cards, but also of sound cards, power supplies and TV cards, refer to the press release about her departure from nVidia that it would be better overall simple, if you look at this, only a partner in area concentrated around so in the future "to offer a better solution can". This means that you believe in to Club 3D AMD and certainly is convinced that this is the right decision for the company from the Netherlands." Source: pctreiber

Message.Title: "Club 3D goes exclusively AMD"
Message.Msg: "Club 3D goes exclusively AMD" "Amsterdam, 10th of June 2013 - Club3D announces today to fully commit to the sale of AMD graphics boards and related products. Judith Ma Tseng - Club3D CEO - "we are showing our commitment to AMD because we believe that AMD is ideally positioned to deliver a complete solution to our customers, and after 16 years in the business offering solutions from a variety of processor partners, we truly believe that we can offer a better solution going forward with AMD alone." "With products like the Radeon HD 7990 Dual GPU, Club3D has a long-standing reputation for delighting enthusiasts with spectacular products based on AMD RadeonTM graphics chips," said Zvika Greenstein, Director of Desktop Product Management, AMD Graphics. "Their decision to join AMD as an exclusive hardware partner is a powerful acknowledgment of our leadership in the graphics space, and a tremendous contribution to the technical expertise in the AMD RadeonTM graphics ecosystem."" Source: Hexus

Message.Title: "Ex-AMD Workers at Nvidia Lose Bid to End Secrets Lawsuit"
Message.Msg: "Ex-AMD Workers at Nvidia Lose Bid to End Secrets Lawsuit" "By Don Jeffrey - Jun 10, 2013 1:36 PM ET Former employees of Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) lost a bid for dismissal of the company’s claims that when they joined competing chipmaker Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) they disclosed trade secrets and urged ex-colleagues to join them. U.S. District Judge Timothy Hillman in Worcester, Massachusetts, today rejected the motion by the ex-employees to dismiss claims including misappropriation of trade secrets and breach of contract. The judge granted a request to throw out a claim of unfair competition. “Plaintiff has demonstrated a likelihood of success on the merits with regard to misappropriation,” Hillman said in an order denying most of the defendants’ motion. " Source: Bloomberg

Topic.Title: "Ex-AMD Workers at Nvidia Lose Bid to End Secrets Lawsuit"

Message.Title: PC Mag reports NEW Mac Book Pro is an AMD WIN?
Message.Msg: ... "More exciting to those in attendance was the first look at the revamped Mac Pro, which is coming later this year, Schiller said. After showing a brief video that offered a glimpse of the sleek, black machine, Schiller responded to recent criticism about Apple's creativity. "Can't innovate anymore, my #$%$," he scoffed. "This is a machine unlike anything we've ever made both inside and out" Schiller said. There's a "new unified thermal core," which "even sounds cool," he quipped. The new Mac Pro will be one-eighth the size of the old Mac Pro. There will be Thunderbolt 2, dual AMD CPUs, and support for 4K displays. The entire top of the Mac Pro is a handle for easy portability. As promised, it will be #$%$embled in the U.S." Source: PCMag

Message.Title: "A bold new look for the Mac Pro desktop"
Message.Msg: ... " The new model has a striking new look. The first view we saw was from the top, where the circular design reminded me of Apple's planned new UFO-like headquarters. It's actually a tall black cylinder, but much smaller than the tower it replaces, fitting into one-eighth the volume of the previous Mac Pro. Components are built around a "central thermal core," and the specs include an Intel Xeon CPU, faster 1866GHz RAM, and new SSD storage that's 2.5 times faster than current SSD drives. Dual AMD FirePro GPUs are supported (even though current MacBook Pros use Nvidia graphics), and the system can output to up to three 4K resolution displays." Source: CNET

Message.Title: CNET reports NEW Mac Pro Desktop is an AMD WIN?
Message.Msg: "Apple has introduced a new version of the high-end Mac Pro desktop at WWDC 2013. The updated model skips Intel's fourth generation of Core i-series processors, previously codenamed Haswell, instead sticking with pro-level Xeon processors. New design, new features In addition, the Mac Pro at long last has a new look and feel. The current tower design is one of the oldest in the Apple catalog, changing little from when it was called the Power Mac G5. Up until now, the Mac Pro has been missing USB 3.0, Thunderbolt, and other features many MacBook users take for granted. Mac Pro (Credit: James Martin/CNET) The new model has a striking new look. The first view we saw was from the top, where the circular design reminded me of Apple's planned new UFO-like headquarters. It's actually a tall black cylinder, but much smaller than the tower it replaces, fitting into one-eighth the volume of the previous Mac Pro. Components are built around a "central thermal core," and the specs include an Intel Xeon CPU, faster 1866GHz RAM, and new SSD storage that's 2.5 times faster than current SSD drives. Dual AMD FirePro GPUs are supported (even though current MacBook Pros use Nvidia graphics), and the system can output to up to three 4K resolution displays. " Source: CNET

Message.Title: Forbes just in: $499 is a dangerous price for Microsoft's Xbox One
Message.Msg: Microsoft dropped a bombshell at its Xbox One press conference today. It came on all of a sudden, without a big flashing number or display. It hung in the air just the same. The Xbox One will retail at $499 when it releases in November, and that could prove a very dangerous price for Microsoft’s new console. That number is so dangerous to Microsoft because it won’t play with casuals, especially not in year one. It is a price aimed directly at the core gaming community. Hardcore gamers are the only people who spend that much money on new consoles — they’re the ones who need to experience the biggest, newest games, no matter what the cost, and they’re the ones who can prop up a system until it grabs a large enough install base. But they’re also the people who have been most vocal about their displeasure with Microsoft Xbox One’s used games policies. To say that the Xbox One is unpopular in the forum communities right now would be an understatement. At a lower price, Microsoft might have been able to focus on the casual consumer, interested in fantasy football and TV integration, but less concerned about DRM and the philosophical implications of always-online. That’s where it seemed the company was heading — building a console for a broad audience that would finally take the games system from a niche piece of hardware to a ubiquitous part of the home entertainment system. With a lower price, or a subscription price, that could have been possible. Last week, analyst Michael Pachter predicted the machine would cost $399 based on the shelf price of the parts, and even that seemed a little pricey — I assumed that Microsoft would be taking the hit in order to tap a broader market and find its way into more people’s homes. Sony ‘s PS3 launched at $599, now widely regarded as a colossal mistake.... SOURCE: Forbes just in At $499, this still feels niche. M

Message.Title: E3: Mad Catz announces Project M.O.J.O, a micro-console powered by Android and agreement signed with Nvidia for GameSmart compatibility
Message.Msg: Mad Catz is starting to really focus on mobile gaming and with good reason too since it is now becoming a major force in the gaming industry. Back during CES 2013 the company unveiled a series of peripherals that would be compatible with most platforms including mobile for mobile gamers. Mad Catz has now announced a partnership with Nvidia revolving around their GameSmart Technology and any product that uses that technology will be compatible with Nvidia Tegra-based devices. The compatibility will be built right into the GameSmart products so there won't be any need for any sort of real set-up aside from tweaking your peripheral's settings to how you want them. The entire line of products that feature GameSmart technology will be compatible with Tegra devices. This includes the R.A.T.M. mouse, F.R.E.Q.M headset, M.O.U.S.9 wireless mouse and the C.T.R.L.R wireless gamepad, all of which can already connect through Bluetooth already. Also in the flurry of Mad Catz announcements for E3 2013 was the mentioning of Project M.O.J.O. which is an Android-powered micro-console. This console will also be seamlessly compatible with any GameSmart product as well. Unfortunately the company doesn't go into detail when it comes to Project M.O.J.O. including what hardware will be coming with it, how big it actually is or any other features. We will have to wait until E3 2013 begins before we get further details on this product. Source: droidgamersDOTcom/index.php/game-news/hardware-a-devices/6218-mad-catz-showing-of-project-m-o-j-o-a-micro-console-powered-by-android-and-agreement-signed-with-nvidia

Message.Title: "Live: Sony to launch PS4 for $399"
Message.Msg: "Live: Sony to launch PS4 for $399" "11:02 p.m.: Cloud service will be available in 2014, for PS3, Vita and PS4. Several titles will be available through service. The PS4 will be available for $399. That's huge. And with that, the event ends. 10:59 p.m.: Sony will have long-term partnership with Bungie and Activision, but doesn't detail exactly how that will work. Sony's Andrew House shifting to cloud-based gaming and Gaikai. 10:57 p.m. Also mentioned earlier during the briefing: online multiplayer will require a PlayStation Plus membership." Source: USA Today

Message.Title: "Xbox One: November Launch, $499 Price Tag"
Message.Msg: "Rather than leave the price of the Xbox One a mystery, Microsoft ripped the band-aid off during its press conference at E3 2013. The Xbox One will cost $499, 499 Euros and 429 British Pounds when it launches in November. That price includes a controller, the new version of Kinect. The console itself comes with 500 GB of storage and a Blu-ray player. Players who pre-order the Xbox One from major retailers will recieve bonus content for Ryse: Son of Rome, Forza Motorsport 5, Kinect Sports Rivals and Dead Rising 3. They’ll also get a commemorative Day One achievement on their Xbox Live accounts, and a special controller with the words “Day One” on it." Source: Time
